info.title: FLAME API
info.description: FLAME project API for interacting with various microservices within the node for the UI.

post.description: Gather the image URL for the requested analysis container and send information to the PO.

get.description: Get the logs for a specific analysis run.
Get the status for a specific analysis run.
Get the pods for a specific analysis run.
Get a local result as file from local storage.
Get an intermediate result as file from the FLAME Hub.

put.description:
Upload a file as an intermediate result to the FLAME Hub. Returns a 202 on success.

This endpoint returns immediately and submits the file in the background.
Upload final results to FLAME Hub

schema.description: Required information for creating a new data store.

delete.description: Delete the listed data store (referred to as services by kong).

schema.description: Unique name of the data store.
schema.title: Data Store Name

parameters.description: Unique name of the data store.

get.description:
List all projects (referred to as routes by kong) available, can be filtered by project_id.

Set "detailed" to True to include detailed information on the linked data stores.

parameters.name: detailed

schema.description: Whether to include detailed information on data stores
schema.title: Detailed

parameters.description: Whether to include detailed information on data stores

post.summary: Create And Connect Project To Datastore
post.description: Connect a project to a data store (referred to as a route by kong).

delete.description: Disconnect a project from all connected data stores (i.e. delete the "route").

parameters.name: project_id

schema.description: UUID of project to be deleted
schema.title: Project Id

parameters.description: UUID of project to be deleted

get.description: List all analyses (referred to as consumers by kong) available, can be filtered by analysis_id.

schema.description: UUID or unique name of the analysis.
schema.title: Analysis Id

parameters.description: UUID or unique name of the analysis.

get.description:
## Perform a Health Check
Endpoint to perform a healthcheck on. This endpoint can primarily be used Docker
to ensure a robust container orchestration and management is in place. Other
services which rely on proper functioning of the API service will not deploy if this
endpoint returns any other HTTP status code except 200 (OK).
Returns:
    HealthCheck: Returns a JSON response with the health status

get.summary: Perform a Health Check on the downstream microservices
get.description: Return the health of the downstream microservices.

200.description: Return HTTP Status code for downstream services

post.summary: Get a token from the IDP
post.description:
Get a JWT from the IDP by passing a valid username and password. 

This token can then be used to authenticate
yourself with this API. If no client ID/secret is provided, it will be autofilled using the hub adapter.

post.summary: Get information about a provided token from the IDP
post.description: Return information about the provided token.

schema.title: Response Inspect Token Token Inspect Post

created_at.title: Created At
created_at.description: Unix epoch when the resource was created.

group.title: Group
group.description: The group that this ACL represents.

tags.title: Tags
tags.description: An optional set of strings associated with the ACL for grouping and filtering.

ACL.title: ACL
ACL.description: ACL entities are used to control access to a resource. An ACL can be applied to a Consumer

ACLConsumer.title: ACLConsumer
ACLConsumer.description: The Consumer to which this ACL is associated. A Consumer can have many ACLs.

Analysis.title: Analysis
Analysis.description: Model representing a single detailed analysis.

AnalysisBuildStatus.title: AnalysisBuildStatus
AnalysisBuildStatus.description: Possible values for analysis build status.

AnalysisRunStatus.title: AnalysisRunStatus
AnalysisRunStatus.description: Possible values for analysis run status.

approval_status.description: Set the approval status of project for the node. Either 'rejected' or 'approved'
Set the approval status of project for the node. Either 'rejected' or 'approved'

project_id.title: Project Id
project_id.description: UUID or name of the project

analysis_id.title: Analysis Id
analysis_id.description: UUID or name of the analysis

data_store_id.title: Data Store Id
data_store_id.description: UUID of the data store or 'gateway'

protocols.title: Protocols
protocols.description: List of acceptable transfer protocols. A combo of 'http', 'grpc', 'grpcs', 'tls', 'tcp'

created_at.title: Created At
created_at.description: Unix epoch when the resource was created.

custom_id.title: Custom Id
custom_id.description: Field for storing an existing unique ID for the Consumer - useful for mapping Kong with users in your existing database. You must send either this field or `username` with the request.

tags.title: Tags
tags.description: An optional set of strings associated with the Consumer for grouping and filtering.

username.title: Username
username.description: The unique username of the Consumer. You must send either this field or `custom_id` with the request.

Consumer.title: Consumer
Consumer.description: The Consumer object represents a consumer - or a user - of a service. You can either rely on Kong as the primary datastore, or you can map the consumer list with your database to keep consistency between Kong and your existing primary datastore.

CreateServiceRequestClientCertificate.title: CreateServiceRequestClientCertificate
CreateServiceRequestClientCertificate.description: Certificate to be used as client certificate while TLS handshaking to the upstream server. With form-encoded, the notation is `client_certificate.id=<client_certificate id>`. With JSON, use `"client_certificate":{"id":"<client_certificate id>"}`.

DeleteProject.title: DeleteProject
DeleteProject.description: Response from disconnecting a project from a datastore.

DetailedAnalysis.title: DetailedAnalysis
DetailedAnalysis.description: Model representing a single detailed analysis.

created_at.title: Created At
created_at.description: Unix epoch when the resource was created.

destinations.title: Destinations
destinations.description: A list of IP destinations of incoming connections that match this route when using stream routing. Each entry is an object with fields "ip" (optionally in CIDR range notation) and/or "port".

headers.title: Headers
headers.description: One or more lists of values indexed by header name that will cause this route to match if present in the request. The `Host` header cannot be used with this hosts should be specified using the `hosts` attribute. When `headers` contains only one value and that value starts with the special prefix `~*`, the value is interpreted as a regular expression.

hosts.title: Hosts
hosts.description: A list of domain names that match this route. Note that the hosts value is case sensitive.

https_redirect_status_code.title: Https Redirect Status Code
https_redirect_status_code.description: The status code Kong responds with when all properties of a route match except the protocol i.e. if the protocol of the request is `HTTP` instead of `HTTPS`. `Location` header is injected by Kong if the field is set to 301, 302, 307 or 308. This config applies only if the route is configured to only accept the `https` protocol.

methods.title: Methods
methods.description: A list of HTTP methods that match this route.

name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the route. Route names must be unique, and they are case sensitive. For example, there can be two different routes named "test" and "Test".

path_handling.title: Path Handling
path_handling.description: Controls how the service path, route path and requested path are combined when sending a request to the upstream. See above for a detailed description of each behavior.

paths.title: Paths
paths.description: A list of paths that match this route.

preserve_host.title: Preserve Host
preserve_host.description: When matching a route via one of the `hosts` domain names, use the request `Host` header in the upstream request headers. If set to `false`, the upstream `Host` header will be that of the services `host`.

protocols.title: Protocols
protocols.description: An array of the protocols this route should allow. See the [route Object](#route-object) section for a list of accepted protocols. When set to only `"https"`, HTTP requests are answered with an upgrade error. When set to only `"http"`, HTTPS requests are answered with an error.

regex_priority.title: Regex Priority
regex_priority.description: A number used to choose which route resolves a given request when several routes match it using regexes simultaneously. When two routes match the path and have the same `regex_priority`, the older one (lowest `created_at`) is used. Note that the priority for non-regex routes is different (longer non-regex routes are matched before shorter ones).

request_buffering.title: Request Buffering
request_buffering.description: Whether to enable request body buffering or not. With HTTP 1.1, it may make sense to turn this off on services that receive data with chunked transfer encoding.

response_buffering.title: Response Buffering
response_buffering.description: Whether to enable response body buffering or not. With HTTP 1.1, it may make sense to turn this off on services that send data with chunked transfer encoding.

snis.title: Snis
snis.description: A list of SNIs that match this route when using stream routing.

sources.title: Sources
sources.description: A list of IP sources of incoming connections that match this route when using stream routing. Each entry is an object with fields "ip" (optionally in CIDR range notation) and/or "port".

strip_path.title: Strip Path
strip_path.description: When matching a route via one of the `paths`, strip the matching prefix from the upstream request URL.

tags.title: Tags
tags.description: An optional set of strings associated with the route for grouping and filtering.

updated_at.title: Updated At
updated_at.description: Unix epoch when the resource was last updated.

DetailedRoute.title: DetailedRoute
DetailedRoute.description: Custom route response model with associated services.

ca_certificates.title: Ca Certificates
ca_certificates.description: Array of `CA Certificate` object UUIDs that are used to build the trust store while verifying upstream server's TLS certificate. If set to `null` when Nginx default is respected. If default CA list in Nginx are not specified and TLS verification is enabled, then handshake with upstream server will always fail (because no CA are trusted).

connect_timeout.title: Connect Timeout
connect_timeout.description: The timeout in milliseconds for establishing a connection to the upstream server.

created_at.title: Created At
created_at.description: Unix epoch when the resource was created.

enabled.title: Enabled
enabled.description: Whether the service is active. If set to `false`, the proxy behavior will be as if any routes attached to it do not exist (404).

host.title: Host
host.description: The host of the upstream server. Note that the host value is case sensitive.

path.title: Path
path.description: The path to be used in requests to the upstream server.

protocol.title: Protocol
protocol.description: The protocol used to communicate with the upstream.

read_timeout.title: Read Timeout
read_timeout.description: The timeout in milliseconds between two successive read operations for transmitting a request to the upstream server.

retries.title: Retries
retries.description: The number of retries to execute upon failure to proxy.

tags.title: Tags
tags.description: An optional set of strings associated with the service for grouping and filtering.

tls_verify.title: Tls Verify
tls_verify.description: Whether to enable verification of upstream server TLS certificate. If set to `null`, then the Nginx default is respected.

tls_verify_depth.title: Tls Verify Depth
tls_verify_depth.description: Maximum depth of chain while verifying Upstream server's TLS certificate. If set to `null`, then the Nginx default is respected.'

updated_at.title: Updated At
updated_at.description: Unix epoch when the resource was last updated.

url.title: Url
url.description: Helper field to set `protocol`, `host`, `port` and `path` using a URL. This field is write-only and is not returned in responses.

write_timeout.title: Write Timeout
write_timeout.description: The timeout in milliseconds between two successive write operations for transmitting a request to the upstream server.

DetailedService.title: DetailedService
DetailedService.description: Custom route response model with associated services.

DownstreamHealthCheck.title: DownstreamHealthCheck
DownstreamHealthCheck.description: Response model for downstream health checks.

HealthCheck.title: HealthCheck
HealthCheck.description: Response model to validate and return when performing a health check.

created_at.title: Created At
created_at.description: Unix epoch when the resource was created.

key.title: Key
key.description: The key that will be used to authenticate the consumer. If this field is not specified, it will be auto-generated.

tags.title: Tags
tags.description: An optional set of strings associated with the Key for grouping and filtering.

KeyAuth.title: KeyAuth
KeyAuth.description: A Key-auth entity represents a key used to authenticate consumers with the key-auth plugin. The key-auth plugin is used to protect API endpoints by requiring a secret key to be sent with the request.

KeyAuthConsumer.title: KeyAuthConsumer
KeyAuthConsumer.description: The Consumer to which this Key is associated. A Consumer can have many Key-auth credentials.

offset.title: Offset
offset.description: Offset is used to paginate through the API. Provide this value to the next list operation to fetch the next page

offset.title: Offset
offset.description: Offset is used to paginate through the API. Provide this value to the next list operation to fetch the next page

offset.title: Offset
offset.description: Offset is used to paginate through the API. Provide this value to the next list operation to fetch the next page

ResultsUploadResponse.description: Response from uploading a file using the results microservice.

When set to only `"https"`, HTTP requests are answered with an upgrade error. When set to only `"http"`, HTTPS requests are answered with an error.

Note that the priority for non-regex routes is different (longer non-regex routes are matched before shorter ones).

request_buffering.title: Request Buffering
request_buffering.description: Whether to enable request body buffering or not. With HTTP 1.1, it may make sense to turn this off on services that receive data with chunked transfer encoding.

response_buffering.description: Whether to enable response body buffering or not. With HTTP 1.1, it may make sense to turn this off on services that send data with chunked transfer encoding.

tags.title: Tags

updated_at.title: Updated At
updated_at.description: Unix epoch when the resource was last updated.

Route.title: Route
Route.description: Route entities define rules to match client requests. Every request matching a given route will be proxied to its associated service.

RouteService.title: RouteService
RouteService.description: The service this route is associated to. This is where the route proxies traffic to.

ca_certificates.title: Ca Certificates
ca_certificates.description: Array of `CA Certificate` object UUIDs that are used to build the trust store while verifying upstream server's TLS certificate. If set to `null` when Nginx default is respected. If default CA list in Nginx are not specified and TLS verification is enabled, then handshake with upstream server will always fail (because no CA are trusted).

connect_timeout.title: Connect Timeout
connect_timeout.description: The timeout in milliseconds for establishing a connection to the upstream server.

created_at.title: Created At
created_at.description: Unix epoch when the resource was created.

enabled.title: Enabled
enabled.description: Whether the service is active. If set to `false`, the proxy behavior will be as if any routes attached to it do not exist (404).

host.title: Host
host.description: The host of the upstream server. Note that the host value is case sensitive.

path.title: Path
path.description: The path to be used in requests to the upstream server.

protocol.title: Protocol
protocol.description: The protocol used to communicate with the upstream.

read_timeout.title: Read Timeout
read_timeout.description: The timeout in milliseconds between two successive read operations for transmitting a request to the upstream server.

retries.title: Retries
retries.description: The number of retries to execute upon failure to proxy.

tags.title: Tags

tls_verify.title: Tls Verify
tls_verify.description: Whether to enable verification of upstream server TLS certificate. If set to `null`, then the Nginx default is respected.

tls_verify_depth.title: Tls Verify Depth
tls_verify_depth.description: Maximum depth of chain while verifying Upstream server's TLS certificate. If set to `null`, then the Nginx default is respected.'

updated_at.title: Updated At
updated_at.description: Unix epoch when the resource was last updated.

url.title: Url
url.description: Helper field to set `protocol`, `host`, `port` and `path` using a URL. This field is write-only and is not returned in responses.

write_timeout.title: Write Timeout
write_timeout.description: The timeout in milliseconds between two successive write operations for transmitting a request to the upstream server.

Service.title: Service
Service.description: service entities are abstractions of upstream services. The main attribute of a service is its URL which can be set as a single string or by specifying the `protocol`, `host`, `port` and `path` individually.

ServiceClientCertificate.title: ServiceClientCertificate
ServiceClientCertificate.description: Certificate to be used as client certificate while TLS handshaking to the upstream server.

retries.title: Retries
retries.description: The number of retries to execute upon failure to proxy. Default:`5`.

host.title: Host
host.description: The host of the upstream server. Note that the host value is case sensitive.

connect_timeout.title: Connect Timeout
connect_timeout.description: The timeout in milliseconds for establishing a connection to the upstream server.

write_timeout.title: Write Timeout
write_timeout.description: The timeout in milliseconds between two successive write operations for transmitting a request to the upstream server. Default: `60000`.

read_timeout.title: Read Timeout
read_timeout.description: The timeout in milliseconds between two successive read operations for transmitting a request to the upstream server. Default: `60000`.

tags.title: Tags
tags.description: An optional set of strings associated with the service for grouping and filtering.

tls_verify_depth.title: Tls Verify Depth
tls_verify_depth.description: Maximum depth of chain while verifying Upstream server's TLS certificate. If set to null, then the Nginx default is respected. Default: null.

ServiceRequest.title: ServiceRequest
ServiceRequest.description: Improved version of the CreateServiceRequest with better defaults.

JWT.description: Pass a valid JWT here for authentication. Can be obtained from /token endpoint.
